targets.query: SELECT "confirmed_cumulative" FROM /^$measurement$/ WHERE ("region" =~ /^$region$/) ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1

select sum(b) / sum(a) * 100 from (select a, b from (select sum(c) as a from (SELECT last("confirmed_cumulative") as c FROM /^$measurement$/ WHERE ("region" != 'None') GROUP BY "region" order by time desc LIMIT 1) order by time desc), (SELECT "confirmed_cumulative" as b FROM /^$measurement$/ WHERE ("region" =~ /^$region$/) ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1) order by time desc) order by time desc;
SELECT "death_cumulative" FROM /^$measurement$/ WHERE ("region" =~ /^$region$/) ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1
SELECT 100*"death_cumulative" / "confirmed_cumulative"  FROM /^$measurement$/ WHERE ("region" =~ /^$region$/) ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1
SELECT "recovered_cumulative"  FROM /^$measurement$/ WHERE ("region" =~ /^$region$/) ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1
SELECT 100*"recovered_cumulative" / "confirmed_cumulative"  FROM /^$measurement$/ WHERE ("region" =~ /^$region$/)  ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1
SELECT "confirmed_cumulative" - "death_cumulative" - "recovered_cumulative"  FROM /^$measurement$/ WHERE ("region" =~ /^$region$/)  ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1
SELECT "severe_cumulative"  FROM /^$measurement$/ WHERE ("region" =~ /^$region$/)  ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1

select 100* mean(a) / mean(b) from (SELECT "severe_cumulative" as a  FROM /^$measurement$/ WHERE ("region" =~ /^$region$/)  ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1), (SELECT ("confirmed_cumulative" - "death_cumulative" - "recovered_cumulative") as b  FROM /^$measurement$/ WHERE ("region" =~ /^$region$/) ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1) order by time desc;
SELECT last("tests_cumulative") as c FROM /^$measurement$/ WHERE ("region" =~ /^$region$/) GROUP BY "region" order by time desc LIMIT 1

panels.description:
Why "High is bad" ? 
We have seen that a decent detection rate is ~10%. An high rate may means that testing is very targeted on symptomatic people. This should come with an high ICU rate.

targets.query: select sum(b) / sum(a) * 100 from (select a, b from (select sum(c) as a from (SELECT last("tests_cumulative") as c FROM /^$measurement$/ WHERE ("region" =~ /^$region$/) GROUP BY "region" order by time desc LIMIT 1) order by time desc), (SELECT "confirmed_cumulative" as b FROM /^$measurement$/ WHERE ("region" =~ /^$region$/) ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1) order by time desc) order by time desc;

panels.title: Detection Rate (High is bad)

list.definition: select distinct(region) from (select region, confirmed_cumulative from /^$measurement$/) ;
list.label: region
list.name: region
list.query: select distinct(region) from (select region, confirmed_cumulative from /^$measurement$/) ;
